You meet with your vassals and [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s court official in the middle of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]'s square.\nAddressing the crowd of commoners gathered all around you, you publicly declare the barbarian ways and an adoption of a just and righteous administration, gesturing for your vassals to do the same. A few murmurs rise from the crowd, but they are swiftly quelled. Then, as the court official set forth the declaration of new governance, you declare your loyalty to the traditions of your people and your ancestors.\nYou all turn towards the imperial regalia brought by court official, bow gracefully before the crowd and ancestors, and renew the Mandate of Heaven.

The hooded priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, but the ceremony begins only after sunset, once they have helped the icons of the new gods adjust to their new home in your temple.\nYou meet with your vassals outside the city, a crowd of your subjects assembling all around you, and then, under the cheers of flowers and booze, the Americanist priests begin the rite. They paint your faces with symbols of liberty and freedom, burn sacred herbs and chant their ancient rites, as you all enter an ecstatic dance.\nMerriment and cheers follow through the night as you declare yourself to the Sea Gods. When you wake at dawn of the next day, the priests are already gone. Little by little, the merry crowd of converts returns to [converting_king.Capital.GetName].

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, carrying strange metal instruments and artifacts. When the time comes they lead you and your vassals to an old, rusted temple near [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting nearby. \nThe priests instruct you to wait and quickly enter the temple. After what feels like hours, the temple, miraculously, lights up, dazzling lights briefly flicker. You and your vassals proclaim on the spot that your old gods are dead, and swear an oath of loyalty to the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The priests lead the crowd into the temple grounds and instruct them in the rituals required to operate it, enduring until the sun begins to set and the temple grounds finally shuts down. When the day is over, they proclaim that you are now workers for the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName].

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your vassals at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by proclaiming that, contrary to what many of your subjects have believed, they may continue worshiping their ancient ways, as long as they swear an oath of allegiance to the Empire. They then begin reciting ancient Quinto passages, instructing you and your followers on the ancient rights and obligations of a proper subject. When the last rays of sun reappear in the distance, you and your vassals swear a final oath, and become true Believer of the Empire.

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Apostle leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets you at a river near the city. Your faithful vassals stand beside you, while the rest of your subjects wait their turn behind them, looking still visibly merry. The Apostle recites a few verses from [mormon.GetScriptureName] before you lead your vassals into the river. As you pass the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests they baptize you, one after the other, in the cold water. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides" the Apostle proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests arrive at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] with a luxurious parade, carrying the tall, golden idol to The Golden Lord to the center of your capital. \nYou meet them with your vassals, surrounded by a crowd of commoners, and publicly renounce your old gods before bowing to the golden idol. \nOne by one, you order your offerings of gold and precious stones to be delivered unto the new god, covering his idol little by little with increasingly more opulent garments. After you and your vassals have finished with your donations, some of the people from the crowd join in as well, leaving what little they have at the feet of the idol as it is carried inside its new home.

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] chroniclers arrive a few days before the ceremony in order to settle in their new temple.\nFor all the remaining days before the event, you and your vassals find yourself stuck listening to an endless list of rules and rituals that the priests swear you must absolutely know in order to correctly worship [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName] without suffering any ill effects. When the day for the mass conversion comes, the ceremony itself looks almost like an afterthought in comparison to the bureaucratic preparation. The chroniclers quickly cleanse all old icons publicly and allow you to renounce your old gods before hiding back inside the temple and resuming their private rituals.

Although the Ancestors built their nation from war, it is a commendable feat for you to have converted an entire score of barbarians through words only. \nYou have no doubts that those that transgress still hide in [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s domain, but now that the ruling class has been brought into the heel, it is only a matter of time until everybody else in the realm follows. With the mass conversion of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName], you have helped spread the bureaucratic institutions to uncivilized realms.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your gods and to teach them how to placate the spirits of industry surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the gods according to tradition, lest ill luck befall them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to the Glory of Unsung King and the glories of the Empire. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and follow The Law, lest ill luck befalls them.

The foolish child is prancing around the Imperial gardens wearing the holy crown of Leonidas.

J'ai été déconcerté[Root.Get_E] de découvrir, quelques heures plus tard, que m[From.GetOnA] [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] était [From.GetLeLa] coupable. Das dumme Kind tänzelnd im kaiserlichen Garten umher und trägt dabei die heilige Krone von Karl dem Großen.

Me desconcertó saber horas más tarde que el culpable era mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName]. Resulta que estaba brincando en los jardines imperiales con la sagrada corona de Carlomagno.
